reviewText:
High school at the most, acting for the best shot.
don't waste your time. Elke is all it has going for it.
below grade "B"

Kooky fun - I'm sure considered scandalous and decadent upon first release but now a kooky time capsule glimpse at what was considered shocking and depraved 40+ years ago. It is a much more realistic look at teens on break than the "beach" movies from the US starring Frankie Avalon. Keep in mind this is the EXACT SAME movie as SWEET VIOLENCE. Difference is SWEET ECSTASY is dubbed with a soft, 4:3 and haggard print while SWEET VIOLENCE is subtitled, widescreen and a pristine print. So, most film fanatics will prefer the SWEET VIOLENCE's transfer to DVD even though it's in French.

Sweet Ecstasy is the very same movie as named Sweet Violence.

I wonder how same movie have different name.

Just to watch a very young, sexy Elke Sommer with her pouting lips makes Sweet Ecstasy worthwhile.  The dramatics of Elke's exploitative character  as a swinger on the French Riveria is interesting and charming. For most of  the movie, Elke Sommer prances about in a skimpy top and revealing  hip-hugger pants that enhances her animalistic sexuality.  The real kicker  that makes Sweet Ecstasy so sweet, however, is the love scene with Elke on  the deck of the yacht.  Elke absolutely sizzles in a very hot, very real,  and very graphic display of young torrid love.  This is a must own video.
A typical pseudo-sexy flick of the era, interesting to cultural history buffs, perhaps, but otherwise, a bit of fluff not worth your time.
My wife watched it. So only going by her feedback
The famous scene of Elke Sommer on the beach made the movie worth it.

Very early 60's about about bored European teen's led by a svengali type professor on the French Rivera.  As a period peice for the 60's, a very interestingmovie...however, I was bored by the ennui that seemed to prevail the characters.

There is a brief scene where Elke is tied to a couch and auctioned off, but a fire interrupted that part of the story arc. That was just about the only  exciting part of her performance, since she didn't have to act.
Junk. B&W plot just a waste of time!
